content.description: Great chimney, I don't know why it's not listed here or in the guide...? Burrow yourself inside the chimney ~10' for solid, clean rock. Run out the first 40' of moderate squeeze. #4 Big Bros might fit. The second half is wider, but has occasional gear that would be bomber. Walk off.

Fantastic offwidth ranging through several sizes marred only by a few short sections of bad rock nearby. The worst of the rock is right off the deck, where you can feel a flake flex under your foot jams. Place a cam up high and fire two or three moves up to solid rock where the real fun begins. The route features a #6 roof halfway up that would be 5.11- if it wasn't for a few thank-goodness hidden face holds.
content.protection:
3-7"

Anchor at old slings or continue higher for 2" crack
content.location: On the west face of the finger. Shaded in the AM.

content.description: Follow two bolts and a pin up the crimpy face and then place some gear on easier terrain to reach the summit where you will need to build an anchor.
content.location: Hike up to the east face of the formation.  The bolts are low and easy to spot from the base.  Walk off the west side to descend.
